722510f-b.text:
Pearl Street, east side, at Maiden Lane. Also shown is Maiden Lane, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Pearl Street. The Second and Third Aves., Elevated is shown on Pearl Street, and the New York Steam Heating Company plant is shown prominently. (Pearl Street, is arbitrarily set to run north and south).
June 13, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, showing a view further south.
June 13, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

722508f-b.text:
Pearl Street, west side, north from and including Maiden Lane and showing a general view northward, as seen from the Seaman's Bank for Savings, at No. 74 Wall Street. Also shown is Maiden Lane, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Pearl Street. The Second and Third Ave., Elevated is shown an Pearl Street. Prominent in the background, is No. 111 John Street at the N.W. corner of Pearl Street. (Pearl Street, is arbitrarily set to run north and south).
June 13, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
October 1, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, showing a closer view of the upper floors of the
smaller buildings.
June 4, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

722511f-b.text:
Pearl Street, south from and including Maiden Lane, and showing a general view southward, as seen from No. 111 John Street. The building in the foreground is No. 1 Cedar Street. The Second and Third Ave., Elevated is shown on Pearl Street. (Pearl Street, is arbitrarily set to run north and south).
July B, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, from a different angle.
July 8, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
